name: Hampton Inn Summersville

reviews.text: We were travelling through from PA to TN and needed to stop for the night. The were very helpful when we called ahead for a reservation and the room was great. Very clean, fresh and nicely furnished. Definitely would stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 11th day of our road trip comming home and West Virginia is a great drive, Summerville captial of the speed trap has one very nice Hampton inn ..We had a king size bed, sofa, fridge ( no micro), wi fi and a clean room...the breakfast was great, bacon, eggs, hot oatmeal, juice all the trimmings for under 100.00 very nice...They have a outside pool that was closed and an exercise room that had more than enough equipment...very nice jewel in the mountians of WV we will be back next year....
reviews.title: Dollar value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the most disappointing Hampton Inn we have ever stayed in. As soon as we walked in the door, I wanted to walk out. Not because it wasn't clean because it was, but for the price, I expected so much more. The room was not only outdated but gloomy. The pillows were much too soft and my husband felt the mattress was uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Dated but clean

reviews.text: The room does have a refrigerator/freezer and microwave.
reviews.title: Wonderfully Accomodating and Clean.

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good with a variety of hot and cold foods.
reviews.title: Always a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff worked very hard to get us on a top floor away from the elevators. Breakfast seems tastier during the weekdays than during the weekend, but is solid given that it is included in the rate. Could be more located close to the actual lake, but overall hotel experience was good.
reviews.title: Hard working staff

reviews.text: Even with the 25 (approximately) minute drive back to the Gorge itself, this hotel was worth it. Facilities were clean and quiet, staff was friendly - overall a great experience. Would recommend the Hampton in Summersville to anyone.
reviews.title: New River Gorge Accomodations

reviews.text: Excellent based on Tracy Beirne. She was the most helpful and considerate person I have met in a long time and made my stressful car breakdown more bearable. I would recommend Hampton Inn to anyone and especially the one in Summersville, WVA. Thank you once again Tracy Beirne.
reviews.title: car problem stay at Hampton Inn

reviews.text: When the first room had an odor coming from the bathroom the service desk immediately moved my family to another room no questions asked. The breakfast was wonderful and had plenty of seating. The outdoor pool was clean and large enough for cooling off of a small group. It was a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Met 100% expectation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because I had some points to use for a free night and this was geographically a good place to stop on our road trip. It was a nice place to stay. The staff was very friendly and allowed us to park our motorcycles under the front cover (which was nice because we had ridden in the rain most of the day). We had been hoping to find restaurants/bars within walking distance but there wasn't much---the clerk at the front desk advised against walking to what was in the area but we stupidly decided we would try anyway. The road was dangerous in the dark and we decided just to pick up some snacks from the convenience store and return to the room. The breakfast was clean and offered a good selection. Rarely do I find a tasty fresh apple at these buffets, but this Hampton Inn offered good fresh fruit at their buffet. The oatmeal was good as well (I love "real" oatmeal...not stuff from an envelope!). Every staff member that we encountered had a smile and a greeting for us. We will stay there again (but won't likely venture out on food in search of dinner).
reviews.title: A nice place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn in Summersville, WV July 19-21, 2013 to attend the Boy Scout National Jamboree on July 20. The staff at the desk upon arrival were very nice, helpful and informative about the traffic situation going to the Jamboree shuttle bus. The room was clean and very quiet. I only live 2 hours away from this Hampton Inn and the drive was worth the stay. Very reasonable price and friendly staff!!
reviews.title: Nice quiet area

reviews.text: We stay here as a "half-way" point on our way to Ohio. It's the best in the area. I think it's pretty expensive for the location. The rooms aren't very quiet. There weren't very many people in the hotel the Thursday night we stayed, but a family was put across the hall from us, who didn't check in until after 10 and who didn't really care about how much noise thier small child was making. The rooms are nice but are in need of updating. Other wise it was good for what we needed. The breakfast has always been a good way to start the morning.
reviews.title: Best Choice for Us

reviews.text: Good staff...very friendly and willing to accommodate. They keep the coffee hot all the time. Rooms are clean and all set up very well. The internet can be a little slow at times. Breakfast is good and there is plenty of hot food with hot coffee. Very easy access to Route 19 and easy to see from that road. At the same time, very quiet and rarely hear anyone, outside or inside. Have never had any problems with the check in or check out.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked into the Hampton Inn as it was the first Hotel on the west side of the hiway as we drove into town on 19. This is about the halfway mark on our trip to Hilton Head Island in SC. We were greeted by a very nice front desk staff and expained the rooms that were available. The room was dated and a little disrepair (wall paper coming loose and just a few little things that need some attention) It was very clean and I liked the fridge and freezer in the room. TV was nice however no HD. Free WIFI worked just fine. Had a great night sleep. We decided the next morning that this would be the place to stay on our way back home. Too bad it was fully booked however Tracey did take our information and said she would let us know if there were any cancellations. We were very happy to hear from Tracey after a couple of days and booked in for our trip home. Breakfast was very nice and loved the little take away bags.
reviews.title: Nice stop over on a trip down south

reviews.text: My family and I usually take two days going from NC to PA. We usually stay in Summersville on Rt. 19 and have stayed at other hotels in this area just for one night. When we arrived at Hampton Inn, the staff had our room keys all ready. The room was bigger than expected and even had a refrigerator, which was unexpected. The bathroom was a bigger size than usual as well. The hotel had a complimentary breakfast, which was more than just coffee and bagels. There was a variety of breakfast items which was beneficial for traveling with children. The staff was also very friendly and would stay there each time passing through.
reviews.title: Nice place for a quick stay

reviews.text: I believe this is my third/fourth time to stay at this hotel over the last 6+ years. This time was still great regarding staff/service. The beds were very comfy. Cleanliness still gets high marks in my opinion. This was our first time to stay during the summer, so it was our first time using the pool. It was a nice outdoor pool. It has a chairlift to aide in entering the pool. Breakfast was typical Hampton...very good. My only "complaint" was that our air shut off often. I tried leaving just the fan on, but it had a very stale smell when I did this. It was rather noisy "off/on" which I know happens in some rooms. When it was off...the fridge in the room took over with a noisy, constant "bubbling" sound. If you are not a light sleeper you should be fine. I will still stay here in the future. I will probably just ask for a 1st or 2nd floor room...maybe they have updated those AC units?
reviews.title: Not quite as good as last time, but still my first choice in Summersville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here to break up a trip from Charlotte to Pittsburg. It was very nice. The room was clean (wonderful bed) and the staff was very courteous and friendly. The lady behind the check in desk actually brought fresh baked cookies out to us when we were sitting in the TV area. The breakfast was much more than a continental breakfast and you could tell the lady who was hosting the breakfast took pride in her job. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the worst Hampton Inns I have stayed in. It was obviously an older building. The clerk in the lobby seemed impatient when I asked about restaurants and other things nearby. TVs in two rooms were distractingly fuzzy in quality. The internet on my laptop in our room was very slow. On the other hand, the hotel seemed very clean and some of the maids were very nice. Due to allergies, I don't usually stay in pet-friendly hotels, but it was not a problem.
reviews.title: Average hotel, not as good as other Hamptons

reviews.text: This hotel could use some updating. The web site indicated the lobby would be redone starting June 1st but breakfast would still be served. I do hope the renovations will include the rooms. While the bed was the comfort you expect with Hampton, the furnishings and walls are showing their age. We were so tired it was fine for our one nights stay.
reviews.title: Good stay - one night stay.

reviews.text: We stay at a lot of Hampton Inn's. We always know we will get a comfortable bed, a great breakfast, and usually pretty quiet hotel. This location was no exception. Everything was very clean, the hotel was incredibly quiet (and we even were on the 1st floor). Breakfast was hot and the staff was wonderful. We only stayed 1 night, but we will continue to stay at this hotel as we travel back and forth between NC and Pittsburgh.
reviews.title: Great stay

description: The Hampton Inn Summersville is the perfect place to stay while visiting West Virginia. Whether you are looking to enjoy a wine tasting at one of the local wineries, river rafting down the Gauley River or trying your hand at various water sports on Summersville Lake, there is no shortage of activities to try. After a day spent exploring the area, settle down to a clean and fresh Hampton bed, free internet access, fitness center, business center and a complimentary, hot breakfast each morning.
